text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Sonoma, California | settlement_type = City | nickname = | motto = | image_skyline = | image_flag = Flag of Sonoma, California.png | flag_size = | image_seal = | seal_size = | image_map = Sonoma_County_California_Incorporated_and_Unincorporated_areas_Sonoma_Highlighted.svg | mapsize = 250x200px | map_caption = Location in Sonoma County and the state of California | pushpin_map = USA | pushpin_map_caption = Location in the United States | pushpin_relief = 1 | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = United States | subdivision_type1 = State | subdivision_name1 = California | subdivision_type2 = County | subdivision_name2 = Sonoma | government_type = Councilâ€“manager | leader_title = | leader_name = | leader_title1 = | leader_name1 = | established_title1 = laid out | established_date1 = 1835 | established_title3 = Incorporated | established_date3 = September 3, 1883 | unit_pref = Imperial | area_footnotes = | area_total_sq_mi = 2.74 | area_land_sq_mi = 2.74 | area_water_sq_mi = 0.00 | area_total_km2 = 7.11 | area_land_km2 = 7.11 | area_water_km2 = 0.00 | area_water_percent = | area_note = | area_metro_km2 = | area_metro_sq_mi = | population_as_of = 2020 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 10739 | pop_est_as_of = | pop_est_footnotes = | population_est = | population_density_sq_mi = 3913.6 | population_density_km2 = 1511.1 | population_urban = 31479 | population_metro = | population_metro_footnotes = | population_density_metro_sq_mi = | timezone = Pacific | utc_offset = -8 | timezone_DST = PDT | utc_offset_DST = -7 | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 26 | elevation_ft = 85 | postal_code_type = ZIP code | postal_code = 95476 | area_code_type = Area code | area_code = 707 | blank_name = FIPS code | blank_info = | blank1_name = GNIS feature IDs | blank1_info = , | website = }} Sonoma is a historic city in Sonoma County, California, United States. As of 2020, the population was 10,739. During the Mexican-American War, Sonoma was the place of the 1846 Bear Flag Revolt. This revolt created the California Republic, a country (with Sonoma as the capital) that existed for less than one month.. Sonoma is also known for its history of historic mineral pool spas. Currently the highest grossing tourist attraction is the acres of vinyards and wineries including B.R. Cohn and Benzinger. ==References== == Other websites == * City of Sonoma Official Website Category:Cities in California Category:Settlements in Sonoma County, California Category:Cities in the San Francisco Bay Area Category:1823 establishments in North America Category:19th-century establishments in California
title: Sonoma, California
